title: How were the different socioeconomic classes affected by the Great Depression? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Wage earners who lost their jobs were immediately destitute. If they couldn’t pay their rent they became homeless. Commodity prices (food) dropped below production costs – not because people didn’t want to buy food but because they couldn’t. Independent farmers were hurt by this but they had homes and could feed themselves. Sharecroppers were tenant farmers. If they could not pay their rent, they lost their farm. This happened to millions because the Dustbowl made their farms unproductive. Their plight is chronicled in The Grapes of Wrath by Steinbeck. If you were independently wealthy, you were fine.
The rich who did not loose in the stock market was able to endure, but the lessor suffered and the poorer suffered more. FDR created the various Corps to build infrastructure to help the poorer.
